title: Richard Pryor, Greatest Hits [Comedy Album, mp3]
description:
Richard Pryor&#039;s Greatest Hits is a compilation of three previous albums. It contains tracks from:

Craps (After Hours)
Studio album by Richard Pryor 
Released 1971
Recorded 1971
Genre Stand-up comedy 


That Nigger&#039;s Crazy
Studio album by Richard Pryor 
Released May 1974 
Recorded early 1974 San Francisco 
Genre Stand-up comedy
 

ÃƒÂ¢?Ã‚Â¦Is It Something I Said? 
Studio album by Richard Pryor 
Released 1975 
Recorded The Latin Casino, Cherry Hill, New Jersey 
Genre Comedy 





---------------------------
---------------------------





Just to clarify, this is Greatest Hits, a compilation of all three of those albums listed abovea and released in 1977, not all three seperate albums.

Often called the greatest stand-up comic of all time, Pryor&#039;s style is clearly as influential today as it was in the 1970s. Eddie Murphy and Chris Rock are obviously deeply influenced by Pryor&#039;s comedy, Murphy often quoting and doing impressions of Pryor particularly in Raw and Delirious.

He&#039;s a brilliant stand-up, and definitely a seminal comedian worth giving a listen.

You&#039;ll like this if you like Eddie Murphy, Chris Rock, Bill Cosby.
